Symptoms_orthopedic.Description: Persistent discomfort or aching in joints.
Inflammation or puffiness around a joint or bone.
Difficulty in moving a joint, especially after rest.
Inability to move a joint through its normal range.
Deep, aching pain in the bones.
Reduced strength in muscles supporting the bones.
Loss of sensation or pins-and-needles feeling, often in extremities.
Visible abnormality in the shape of bones or joints.
Chronic or acute pain in the lower or upper back.
Feeling of giving way or lack of support in a joint.
Crackling or grinding sound in a joint during movement.
Trouble with mobility due to pain or instability.
Discoloration of the skin due to injury to bones or soft tissues.
Sensitivity to touch or pressure over a bone or joint.
